resources.string: Could not complete the capturing. Please pan in the correct direction.
Could not complete the capturing. Please pan more slowly.
Could not complete the capturing. Please pan faster.
Take a panoramic photo by sweeping your camera
"Creating the following files: - Multi Angle image - 3D image Note: These files contain a gray area."
"Creating the following files: - Multi Angle image - 3D image"
"Processing... This image contains a gray area"
Please wait for a few seconds to launch 3D camera
Unplug the cable. You cannot take a photo in this mode with a cable connected.
Could not take picture. Please pan in the correct direction.
Could not take picture. Please pan more slowly.
Could not take picture. Please pan faster.
Change direction by tapping icon on the left
Press the camera key and slowly pan the camera
Tap the camera button and slowly pan the camera
Double-tap to switch to auto dual camera
Double tap to turn on Dual camera
Double tap to turn off Dual camera
Reset all settings to default values
Double tap to switch to normal mode
Double tap to switch to wide angle mode
Double tap to switch to front camera
Double-tap to switch to the main camera
Double tap to switch to camera
Double tap to switch to video
Double tap to turn on HDR
Double tap to turn off HDR
To save locations, you have to enable GPS and/or wireless networks. Enable now?
Use your fingers to edit the displayed image
Tap the portion you want to color
Camera will close soon due to inactivity
Tap this to select another mode
Find the best shot by sliding the thumbnails up or down
Cannot burst due to low battery
Burst capture by HW camera key
Turn on Burst with camera key settings to enable burst shot
Cannot burst with Dual camera On
Burst photos are saved to internal storage
SD card full. Default data storage changed to Internal storage.
SD card inserted. Change default data storage to SD card?
Internal storage full. Save data in SD card instead?
Internal storage is corrupt or write protected. Save data in SD card instead?
SD card full. Save data in internal storage instead?
Cannot use SD card. Save data in internal storage instead?
For stable capturing or recording, we recommend you change data storage to internal storage or use a high-speed SD card (Class 10 or higher recommended).
The following functions are currently disabled.
Please wait for your device to cool down and then restart the camera.
Some functions disabled by temperature rise
Record video in 4K ultra high definition
Select effects for artistic photos and videos
Put your face in photos and videos using the front & main cameras
Mask your face with the face of your friend to take an impressive selfie
You can get more details or take action on what you see using Google Lens.
You can get more details or take action on what you see using %1$s
Record high frame rate video and apply slow motion effects
Record the same scene from multiple angles on a single screen
Take photos with background sound (birds chirping, etc.)
Find the best in the burst photos taken before and after your shot
Not enough battery on the phone. When the battery is low, the camera will close automatically.
Recording stopped due to low battery. Charge your device and try again.
Cannot use camera due to low battery. Charge your device and try again.
To take continuous shots, select Timeshift burst in Camera apps
Resolution for the following capturing modes have been changed to 13MP (4:3) due to a Software update
If the device temperature rises, the app may close during use. Your recording will be saved automatically.

"This camera mode uses a lot of your phone's resources and may cause your phone's temperature to rise. To prevent overheating, video recording may stop and the camera app may close. Your recording will be saved automatically."
Burst capturing stopped due to out of memory. Delete some files to free some space on the internal storage.

You can record videos even in high contrast scene, and make them more dramatic and closer to what you see in real life. Please use supported devices/services to enjoy the content with its original color and brightness.
This mode is unavailable when recording is in progress in another app.
Cannot start camera. Restart camera or device.
Could not save photos. There may be a problem with the data storage. If Data storage is set to SD card, check your SD card.
Could not start recording. There may be a problem with the data storage. If Data storage is set to SD card, check your SD card.
Your Xperia needs to cool down. Please wait.
The device temperature is rising. If it continues to rise, the app will close automatically.
Your camera will need to cool. If you are recording, we may need to automatically save your video and exit until the camera has cooled.
Camera will now turn off temporarily to cool down.
Your camera needs to cool. Your recording will be saved and application exited until your device is properly cooled.
Internal memory full. Changed default data storage to SD card.
Internal storage is corrupt or write protected. Data storage changed to SD card.
Memory full. Delete some files from SD card or Internal storage.
Maximum number of faces has been selected. Please deselect one or more faces and try again.
Memory full. Delete some files from SD card.
Memory full. Delete some files from the memory or change the default data storage.
Cannot add more files. File size too large.
"Recording in progress in another app. Couldn't record."
No SD card available. Changed default data storage to Internal storage.
Cannot record. Recording or a recording-related function may be in use by another application.
Keep your eyes on the front camera near the ear speaker
Delete this face? This action cannot be reversed.
Please point the camera towards a face
Tap the square(s) to select face(s)
To change the capturing mode, unlock the screen. Unlock?
To open the settings, unlock the screen.
Swipe the screen to switch to another capturing mode such as Video or Manual, and switch between the main and front camera.
You can switch between the main and front cameras by swiping the screen
Make sure to hold your device still
Camera lens located as shown in illustration
Move farther away from the object
Make your skin look bright and smooth. The effect works in the applications that use the front camera. This can be applied on photos and videos. You can also adjust the level.
"Cannot start app. Make sure the latest version of %1$s is installed and enabled on your device."
Turn your palm toward the camera. Self-timer will be turned on when your palm is recognized. To make it easy to be recognized, extend your fingers upward.
Turn your palm toward the camera
Because Still HDR captures and combines two images of the same scene, it is only suitable for still objects.
ISO value has also been changed
Stay at least 1 meter away from the object when taking photos with dual camera on. Getting close to the object may cause a shift of the viewpoint or color.
You can turn dual camera on and off in manual mode. Turn it on to take low-noise photos in low light conditions. Turn it off to take close-up photos.
Recording stopped due to maximum file size limitation or not enough space on SD card
Recording stopped due to maximum recording time limitation
Recording stopped due to maximum recording time limitation
Memory full. Zoom is currently not available.
Drag the middle of the split bar to switch to full screen %1$s to use
"Another device is now connected. Would you like to share the image through the viewfinder with the device?"
"Cannot connect with any Sony's Wi-Fi/NFC camera when your Xperia is connected with another Xperia."
"App version doesn't match. Cannot connect. Your app needs to be updated."
This mode is unavailable during Wi-Fi tethering.
"Only one Sony's Wi-Fi/NFC camera can be connected with your Xperia at a time."
Touch the devices together to connect

If the device that you connect with is also connected with other Xperia devices through this app, your Xperia will be also automatically connected to those devices and every image through the viewfinder will be shared between your Xperia and all the connected devices.
Tap to add a device. The image through its viewfinder will appear here.
"Cannot connect with any Xperia when your Xperia is connected with a Sony's Wi-Fi/NFC camera."
Allow the app to control the system for stable capturing, depending on the temperature in the device.

"The camera has been launched automatically by detecting your motion of lifting up your phone in landscape mode and aiming it towards an object. You can select your favorite way to use this feature from Smart launch in camera settings."
Touch inside the circle to capture
Tap inside of the circle to view fullscreen
Touch inside of the circle to launch camera

"You can launch the camera quickly. Swiftly lift your device in landscape mode and aim the camera towards an object. The camera will be launched automatically. You can select your favorite way to use this feature from Smart launch in camera settings."

"You can launch the camera quickly. Swing up your device in landscape mode and aim the camera towards an object. The camera will be launched automatically. You can turn off this feature from Smart launch in camera settings."
Tag your photos and videos with the locations where they are taken. You can change this setting later from Save location in the Camera settings.
This setting is not supported for the current resolution or scene. To configure this setting, change resolution or scene selection.
This setting does not support the current still image size. To configure this setting, change the still image size.
This setting is not supported for the current scene. To configure this setting, change scene selection.
Unable to change video size in slow motion mode. To configure this setting, exit slow motion mode.
This setting is not available with HDR On. To configure this, turn off HDR.
This setting is not supported for the current video resolution or scene. To configure this setting, change video resolution or scene selection.
This setting is not supported for the current video size. To configure this setting, change video size.
The app requires the following permission(s) to perform this action.
To grant permissions, go to App info > Permissions.
The app requires the following permission(s) to perform this action.
"To use an SD card, the camera needs permissions to access the SD card. Change the data storage to SD card again, or allow the camera to access the SD card on the next screen."

"A new SD card requiring permissions has been detected.
To use the SD card as data storage, please select the SD card or DCIM directory on the next screen."

"The SD card or DCIM directory was not selected. The SD card cannot be used.
To grant permissions, start by changing the save location to the SD card, or select the appropriate directory on the next screen."

"New SD card detected which requires permissions. Internal device storage will therefore be used as the default data storage.
To use SD card as data storage, please go to camera settings and change the storage option to SD card."
To save photos and videos on SD card
Keep your eyes on the camera
Side sense is not supported on this screen
To use this function, go to Settings > Display and turn on Side sense. Enable now?

"You can take a photo or video by simply double-tapping the sensor on the side of the screen instead of the shutter button. You can also zoom in or out by sliding your finger along this side sensor. Both photo and video mode support this function. You can turn this off from Side sense in camera settings."

"You can take a photo or video by simply double-tapping the sensor on the side of the screen in portrait view instead of the shutter button. You can also zoom in or out by sliding your finger along this side sensor. Both photo and video mode support this function. You can turn this off from Side sense in camera settings."

"You can take a photo or video by simply double-tapping the sensor on the side of the screen in portrait view instead of the shutter button. Both photo and video mode support this function. You can turn this off from Side sense in camera settings."

"You can take a photo or video by simply double-tapping the sensor on the side of the screen instead of the shutter button. Both photo and video mode support this function. You can turn this off from Side sense in camera settings."
Recording style and screen resolution can be changed in Camera settings
You can change the fps and recording style for slow motion
"Instantly record a precious moment in %1$s fps slow motion by tapping the button in the center of the screen. Recording in bright conditions will help you create a better video."
You can record a right moment with %1$s fps by tapping the center button
Instantly record a precious moment in %1$s fps slow motion by tapping the button in the center of the screen
Record a video with %1$s fps and apply slow motion effects
You can record a video with multiple slow motion parts (120 fps slow motion)
Record a video and then edit it to make select parts in slow motion. Tap the button in center of the screen to set the parts as slow motion.
"Make an impressive video by showing a precious moment in slow motion. Recording in bright conditions will help you create a better video."
You can record video at different speeds by switching to %1$s fps
"Tap the button in the center at the right moment"
Make an impressive video by showing a precious moment in slow motion
Start video recording by tapping the record button
Tap the button in the center of the screen to record in slow motion. Tap stop button to stop recording.

You can take beautiful photos with low noise by using dual camera even at night or in the low-lit room. Camera automatically switches between single camera and dual camera based on the scenes to take with Ultra-high sensitivity.
I consent to the Sony Mobile Terms of Use.
Your use of this service may be subject to mobile data charges depending on your data plan.

Sony Mobile will collect your hashed Android ID unique device identifier, location-based data and timestamp in order to provide you with appropriate results as part of the service and for service improvements.
To use Touch focus, change the focus setting to AF (auto focus).
Recording in bright conditions will help you create a better video
Swipe to switch to another capturing mode such as Video or Manual
Use of camera restricted for security reasons
For stable 4K video recording, you must not change this setting unless you use a high-speed SD card (UHS Speed Class 1 or higher, or Speed Class 10 recommended).
For stable Timeshift video recording, you must not change this setting unless you use a high-speed SD card (UHS Speed Class 1 or higher, or Speed Class 10 recommended). Change anyway?
"For stable slow motion video recording, don't change this setting unless you use a high-speed SD card (UHS Speed Class 1 or higher, or Speed Class 10 recommended)."

"For stable video recording, we recommend you change data storage to Internal storage. Would you like to change now?
If you continue to use SD card as data storage, be sure to use a high-speed SD card (UHS Speed Class 1 or higher, or Speed Class 10 recommended)."

You can record beautiful videos with low noise by using dual camera, even at night or in a low-lit room. Camera automatically switches between single camera and dual camera based on the scenes to record with Ultra-high sensitivity.
Keep at least 1 meter away from the object when recording with dual camera. Getting close to the object may cause a shift of the view point or color when recording in Ultra-high sensitivity.
Use dual camera for video recording?
To take great close-up photos, tap No and switch to single camera. You can change it back to dual camera anytime by tapping the button on the viewfinder.
Captures a wider area in half the recording time, differing from HD.
Captures a narrower area in twice the recording time, differing from Full HD.
Use volume key to zoom in/out
%1$s requires an update to the Android Wear app.
"%1$s won't run unless you update the Android Wear app."
%1$s requires one or more Google Play services that are not currently available. Please contact the developer for assistance.
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your phone."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your tablet."
The specified account does not exist on this device. Please choose a different account.
An application requires Google Play services to be enabled.
A data connection is required to connect to Google Play services.
An application requires an update for Google Play services.
Error signing in the specified account. Please choose a different account.
Unknown issue with Google Play services.
%1$s relies on Google Play services, which is not supported by your device. Contact the manufacturer for assistance.
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
Disable low power mode on high temp.
Execute settings migration at the next launch
Please kill process and relaunch camera after this is changed
